results.name: Decimal expansion of the continued fraction 1+1/(1+2/(1+3/(1+4/(1+5/(1+...))))).
reference: B. C. Berndt, Y.-S. Choi and S.-Y. Kang, The problems submitted by Ramanujan to the Journal of the Indian Mathematical Society, Continued Fractions: From Analytic Number Theory to Constructive Approximation, ed. B. C. Berndt and F. Gesztesy, Amer. Math. Soc., 1999, pp. 15-56.
S. R. Finch, "Mathematical Constants", Cambridge, pp. 423-428.
H. S. Wall, Analytic Theory of Continued Fractions, Van Nostrand, 1948, pp. 356-358, 367
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Continued Fraction Constants
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Generalized Continued Fraction
formula: Equals the reciprocal of sqrt(pi*e/2)*erfc(1/sqrt(2)), where erfc is the complementary error function.
xref: Cf. A225435, A225436 (numerators and denominators of convergents to c.f.).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, based on correspondence from Tom Raes (tommy1729(AT)hotmail.com) and _Steven Finch_, Sep 22 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_ and _Hans Havermann_, Oct 17 2005
